title: Crolimus 10G Oint
details: It is used on the skin to treat a skin condition called eczema (atopic dermatitis) in patients who have not responded well to (or should not use) other eczema medications.
precautions: Before using tacrolimus, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or to other macrolide medications (such as sirolimus); or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. This medication should not be used if you have certain medical conditions. Before using this medicine, consult your doctor or pharmacist if you have swollen lymph nodes (e.g., lymphadenopathy, mononucleosis), use of light therapy (e.g., UVA or UVB), skin or other cancers. This medication may make you more sensitive to the sun. Limit your time in the sun. Avoid tanning booths and sunlamps. Use sunscreen and wear protective clothing when outdoors. Tell your doctor right away if you get sunburned or have skin blisters/redness. Do not apply this medication to open wounds or infected areas. Do not cover the treated area with plastic or waterproof bandages unless directed to do so by your doctor.
effects: Stinging, burning, soreness, or itching in the area of treated skin may occur during the first few days of treatment. Headache, acne, "hair bumps" (folliculitis), stomach upset, flu-like symptoms (e.g., fever, chills, runny nose, sore throat, muscle aches), or increased sensitivity of the skin to hot/cold/pain/touch may also occur. If any of these effects persist or worsen, tell your doctor or pharmacist promptly.

title: Ristases Opthalmic 10ML Emulsion 1x1 (P)
details: Used to Severe Keratitis In Dry Eyes Disease.
precautions: Glaucoma, History Of Ocular Herpes.
effects: Blurred Vision, Headache, Local Erythma.

title: Amorin 50MG Tab 10x10 (L)
details: It is used to prevent organ rejection in people who have received a kidney transplant. It is usually taken along with other medications to allow your new kidney to function normally. It is also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis.
precautions: Use With Caution having Kidney disease, Liver disease, Cancer, Certain enzyme disorders (TPMT deficiency, NUDT15 deficiency).
effects: Nausea, Vomiting, Diarrhoea, Muscle Pain.

title: Inograf 0.5MG Cap 1x30 (L)
details: It is used with other medications to prevent rejection of a kidney, heart, or liver transplant.
precautions: Use with caution having mineral imbalances, Kidney disease, Cancer, Liver disease, High blood pressure, Diabetes.
effects: Shaking, Headache, Diarrhea, Nausea/vomiting, Upset stomach, Loss of appetite, Trouble sleeping and Numbness or Tingling of the hands/feet.

effects: Constipation, Nausea, Headache, Diarrhea, Vomiting, Stomach upset, Gas, Tremor, Dizziness, Drowsiness, or Trouble sleeping may occur.

title: Rhophylac 300MCG Inj 1x1 (P)
details: This drug is indicated in Pregnancy/delivery of an Rh-positive baby irrespective of the ABO groups of the mother and baby, Abortion/threatened abortion at any stage of gestation, Ectopic pregnancy, Transfusion of Rh incompatible blood or blood produ READ MORE
precautions: Before taking this medication, tell your doctor or pharmacist if you are allergic to it; or if you have any other allergies. This product may contain inactive ingredients, which can cause allergic reactions or other problems. Talk to your pharmacist for more details. For Intramuscular Injection Only. Do not inject the newborn infant. Common medications checked in combination with immune globulin intravenous. Aspirin Low Strength (aspirin) Bactrim (sulfamethoxazole / trimethoprim) Benadryl (diphenhydramine) CellCept (mycophenolate mofetil) Cymbalta (duloxetine) Gammagard (immune globulin intravenous and subcutaneous) Klonopin (clonazepam).
effects: Fever, back pain, nausea and vomiting, hypo- or hypertension, hemoglobinuria/emia, elevated bilirubin and creatinine and decreased haptoglobin.

title: Certican 0.25MG Tab 6x10 (L)
details: Everolimus is used to treat Kidney, Breast, Pancreas, Lung, Stomach/intestinal cancers. Everolimus is also used in people with a certain genetic Tuberous sclerosis complex to treat certain types of benign tumors in the brain or kidney.
precautions: Taking everolimus may decrease your ability to fight infection from bacteria, viruses, and fungi and increase the risk that you will get a serious or life-threatening infection.
effects: Diarrhea, Constipation, Change in ability to taste food, Weight loss, Dry mouth, Weakness, Headache, Difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep, Nosebleed, Dry skin, Acne, Hair loss, Pain in the arms, legs, back or joints, Muscle cramps, Missed or irregular menstrual periods, Heavy menstrual bleeding, Difficulty getting or keeping an erection, Anxiety, Aggression or other changes in behavior.
